data.text: @katruns26point2 @hanchicago @esthery @JTGenter @ajlamesa Sounds like a lot of fun:) Be careful and hope u enjoy ur trip!
@ItoLeda @hanchicago @esthery @JTGenter @ajlamesa It’s a 2-week trip to Japan +3 days Seoul
@JTGenter We can only be hopeful💕 I am glad you shared the notice as everyone has shifted from Pandemic to Putin. It’s important to be aware of everything
@MasterofResults Right. But I've seen so many reopening predictions fail to come to pass that I'm wary of any predictions right now 😕

@katruns26point2 @hanchicago @esthery @JTGenter @ajlamesa A trip to South Korea? No need to cancel it. Just reschedule it & give it a few more weeks. If they can contain the wave they will. There's way too much uncertainty now.
@JTGenter Most information shows 4th qtr 2023 as the potential.
@katruns26point2 @hanchicago @JTGenter @ajlamesa Oh no!!! Hope they all recover without incident 😓

@hanchicago @esthery @JTGenter @ajlamesa That's the point - I'm not being political. I'm just trying to ascertain whether I need to cancel a trip I've planned. And in the interim, I learned that my relatives in Korea, including an infant, have Covid now. 😧

@katruns26point2 @esthery @JTGenter @ajlamesa If the Omicron wave behaves there like it has just about everywhere else, the numbers should quickly come down, certainly by the summer; but who knows how the Korean government (and other Asian governments) will respond. Asia seems to be taking a much more measured approach.
@katruns26point2 @esthery @JTGenter seems like that kind of situation should make them more likely to reopen the borders; travel restrictions are now useless
